trans-unit.source: Reuse your Objective-C code with the Windows Bridge for iOS
trans-unit.target: Reuse your Objective-C code with the Windows Bridge for iOS

trans-unit.source: This guide is designed to help you port your iOS app to Windows 10 manually.
trans-unit.target: This guide is designed to help you port your iOS app to Windows 10 manually.

trans-unit.source: If your app is written entirely in Objective-C, you can alternatively use the Windows Bridge for iOS to quickly move your app to Windows 10 while reusing much of your existing code.
trans-unit.target: If your app is written entirely in Objective-C, you can alternatively use the Windows Bridge for iOS to quickly move your app to Windows 10 while reusing much of your existing code.

trans-unit.source: The iOS bridge enables you to build Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps in Visual Studio 2015 using Objective-C code and iOS API libraries.
trans-unit.target: The iOS bridge enables you to build Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps in Visual Studio 2015 using Objective-C code and iOS API libraries.

trans-unit.source: You can also use the bridge to extend your Objective-C code with unique Windows 10 features like Cortana and Live Tiles.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the bridge to extend your Objective-C code with unique Windows 10 features like Cortana and Live Tiles.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about the Windows Bridge for iOS
trans-unit.target: Learn more about the Windows Bridge for iOS

trans-unit.source: Why Windows?
trans-unit.target: Why Windows?

trans-unit.source: Are you an iOS developer, wondering how to make the move to Windows 10 and the UWP?
trans-unit.target: Are you an iOS developer, wondering how to make the move to Windows 10 and the UWP?

trans-unit.source: It needn't be as scary as you think.
trans-unit.target: It needn't be as scary as you think.

trans-unit.source: We've got the tools, techniques, and info you need to make great apps that work as well on Windows as they do on your iOS devices: maybe better!
trans-unit.target: We've got the tools, techniques, and info you need to make great apps that work as well on Windows as they do on your iOS devices: maybe better!

trans-unit.source: Porting your Android or iOS app to Windows and Windows Phone
trans-unit.target: Porting your Android or iOS app to Windows and Windows Phone

trans-unit.source: If you are considering porting your apps, or developing new apps for Windows 10, then we've got your back.
trans-unit.target: If you are considering porting your apps, or developing new apps for Windows 10, then we've got your back.

trans-unit.source: In this section, you'll find introductions to using Visual Studio and sample code that will make sense to you, as an iOS developer.
trans-unit.target: In this section, you'll find introductions to using Visual Studio and sample code that will make sense to you, as an iOS developer.

trans-unit.source: We want you to enjoy writing apps for Windows 10, and we think you will.
trans-unit.target: We want you to enjoy writing apps for Windows 10, and we think you will.

trans-unit.source: Imagine a world in which you write code once, and it runs on desktops, laptops, phones, games consoles, embedded devices and even Holographic displays.
trans-unit.target: Imagine a world in which you write code once, and it runs on desktops, laptops, phones, games consoles, embedded devices and even Holographic displays.

trans-unit.source: Welcome to Windows 10 and the UWP!
trans-unit.target: Welcome to Windows 10 and the UWP!

trans-unit.source: come to the dark side?
trans-unit.target: come to the dark side?

trans-unit.source: If you already know Windows, and want to expand your reach to iOS, take a look at Microsoft Visual Studio 2015.
trans-unit.target: If you already know Windows, and want to expand your reach to iOS, take a look at Microsoft Visual Studio 2015.

trans-unit.source: With integral support for mobile application development based on Xamarin, you can now create apps for iOS devices from within Visual Studio, compiling and running code using a paired Mac computer.
trans-unit.target: With integral support for mobile application development based on Xamarin, you can now create apps for iOS devices from within Visual Studio, compiling and running code using a paired Mac computer.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio can become the heart of your mobile development world, sharing code and development tools between Windows, Android and iOS.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio can become the heart of your mobile development world, sharing code and development tools between Windows, Android and iOS.
